exhibition_title: Highlights from the Harrison Collection of Fine Photographs, 1992-2006
exhibition_description: The creation of the Alfred and Ingrid Lenz Harrison Fund has had an enormous impact on the growth and quality of the Instituteâ€™s collection of fine photographs since its inception in 1973. This exhibition celebrates the collection by showcasing nearly one hundred photographic prints by such notable photographers as Henri Cartier-Bresson, Dorothea Lange, Robert Frank, Werner Bischoff, Arnold Newman, and numerous other major figures in the history of twentieth-century photography. The exhibition will be presented in the newly expanded Harrison Photography Gallery.
